item.description:
Spring! Its supposed to be clear & sunny, and in the 40's on Saturday, so lets make the most of it! I recommend wearing light layers that you can peel off as your body heats up.

The ride will begin at 11:15am, and we will return to Concord Center for a bite to eat afterward. I hope that we can maintain a decent pace in the neighborhood of 15MPH, maybe a bit faster, but we'll play it by ear. The ride is approx 20 miles, I have done this route 3 or 4 times and I love the rolling hills, back roads, and farm scenery.

Last time I rode this, (last summer) there was a bridge out at the beginning of the ride... Hopefully the construction is done, but if not, there is a short distance to carry your bike. Speaking of bikes, you are welcome to ride any kind of bike you want so long as you can keep up with the group. I will be riding a road bike.

Also, if you find that you don't think you can do the whole 20, there is a shortcut that cuts 5 miles out of the route. I can show it to you on the map when we Meet-Up.

This is a great "First Ride of the Year" type of ride if you haven't been biking over the winter months.


Click links below for additional details:

Here is a Map of the Meet-up Spot

Street View of Meet-Up Spot

Route Map


See you there!
- Jon
item.how_to_find_us: I will be the guy with the orange bag
item.name: 20 Mile Ride in Concord
